text: Maulana Mohammad Amin () was a Persian statesman in Safavid Iran, who served as the munshi al-mamalik ("state scribe") and was the head of the insha al- mamalik ("imperial correspondence") under Shah Abbas I from 1588 till his death in 1591/2. He was the grandson of Maulana Adham, who was a prominent chancellery official during the late reign of Ismail I, and the early reign of the latters successor Tahmasp I. == Sources == * Category:16th-century Iranian people Category:1591 deaths Category:16th-century births Category:Safavid civil servants
title: Maulana Mohammad Amin
